intro: Calochortus nuttallii var. panamintensis, commonly known as the Panamint mariposa lily, is a flowering plant native to the deserts of California and Nevada. It is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming a basal rosette. This variety is part of the Calochortus genus, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their ornamental value.
